snippet: Mannequins with bulging bosoms have become standard in Venezuela, reflecting the country’s embrace of plastic surgery even among those who can least afford it.
abstract: Mannequins with bulging bosoms and otherwise voluptuous proportions are becoming standard in Venezuela, reflecting  country’s embrace of plastic surgery even among those who can least afford it; embrace of plastic surgery clashes with government’s socialist ideology and frequent talk of creating society free of taint of commercialism, but is an increasingly reality for much of nation.

byline.contributor: María Eugenia Díaz, Paula Ramón and Jimmy Chalk contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.

lead_paragraph: Mannequins with bulging bosoms have become standard in Venezuela, reflecting the country’s embrace of plastic surgery even among those who can least afford it.

headline.main: Mannequins Give Shape to a Venezuelan Fantasy
headline.print_headline: Mannequins Give Shape to Venezuelan Fantasy
